Class User

java.lang.Object
  com.epoch.User

public class User
extends Object

A single ACE user.

Constant Field Values

TA

public static final char TA
Value for role. This value is not stored in the database; it is used in gradebook operations only.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

userId

public String userId
User's login (UK) or SMS (Pearson) ID.

passwordHash

private byte[] passwordHash
Hashed password of this user. Used only in UK version.

Role of user: student, instructor, administrator.

Whether this instructor has been verified. Used only in UK version.

Phrases encountered by this user that have been translated.

savePassword

private boolean savePassword
A flag to say that DB layer must not overwrite the current password with the value in this object; instead leave it as it is.

STARS_REGEX

private static final String STARS_REGEX
Delimiter for variable phrases (to be substituted with other phrases) inside of translations.

Determines whether this user is a temporary exam-student.

true if this user is a temporary exam-student

getLanguages

public final void getLanguages()
Gets the non-English languages selected by this user in the preference order set by the user. Called here and from saveLanguages.jsp.

setLanguage

public void setLanguage(String language)
Sets a temporary non-English language for this user without saving it to the database. Called by nologin/entries.jsp.

Parameters:
language - non-English language

                      throws DBException

newOrder - new position of each language in current order of languages

DBException

removeLanguage

public void removeLanguage(int removePosn)
                    throws DBException
Removes one of this user's languages.

Parameters:
removePosn - 1-based position of the language to be removed, in the current order of the languages
Throws:
DBException

translateJS

public String translateJS(String phrase)
Gets Javascript-compatible translation of a phrase, or returns the original in Javascript-compatible form if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.

This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
Returns:
Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

translate

public String translate(String phrase)
Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.

The translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
Returns:
translated phrase or the original

translateJS

public String[] translateJS(String[] phrases)
Gets Javascript-compatible translations of phrases, or leaves them unmodified if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.

This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

Parameters:
phrases - phrases to translate
Returns:
Javascript-compatible translated phrases or the originals

translate

public String[] translate(String[] phrases)
Translates phrases, or leaves unmodified if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.

Each translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found for a phrase, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

Parameters:
phrases - phrases to translate
Returns:
translated phrases or the originals

translate

public String translate(String phrase,
                        int num)
Gets translation of selected phrase, or returns the original (and stores it in the database) if the translation is not found, and substitutes the given number into the phrase. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
num - a number to substitute into the phrase
Returns:
translated phrase or the original

translateJS

public String translateJS(String phrase,
                          int num)
Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".

This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
num - a number to substitute into the phrase
Returns:
Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

translate

public String translate(String phrase,
                        float num)
Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the given number into the phrase. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
num - a number to substitute into the phrase
Returns:
translated phrase or the original

translateJS

public String translateJS(String phrase,
                          float num)
Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".

This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
num - a number to substitute into the phrase
Returns:
Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

translateJS

public String translateJS(String phrase,
                          String substn)
Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".

This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
substn - a word or two to substitute into the translated phrase
Returns:
Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

translate

public String translate(String phrase,
                        String substn)
Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the second string into the phrase. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".

The translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
substn - a word or two to substitute into the translated phrase
Returns:
translated phrase or the original

translateJS

public String translateJS(String phrase,
                          int[] nums)
Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word1*** blah blah ***word2*** blah". The order of ***word1*** and ***word2*** may be different in the translation.

This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
nums - numbers to substitute into the phrase
Returns:
Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

translate

public String translate(String phrase,
                        int[] nums)
Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the given numbers into the phrase. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word1*** blah blah ***word2*** blah". The order of ***word1*** and ***word2*** may be different in the translation.

The translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
nums - numbers to substitute into the phrase
Returns:
translated phrase or the original

translateJS

public String translateJS(String phrase,
                          String[] substns)
Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word1*** blah blah ***word2*** blah". The order of ***word1*** and ***word2*** may be different in the translation.

This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
substns - strings to substitute into the phrase
Returns:
Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

translate

public String translate(String phrase,
                        String[] substns)
Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the given Strings into the phrase. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word1*** blah blah ***word2*** blah". The order of ***word1*** and ***word2*** may be different in the translation.

The translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

Parameters:
phrase - a phrase to translate
substns - strings to substitute into the phrase
Returns:
translated phrase or the original
